questions.text: ________ scientist introduced vaccine for Smallpox vaccine
Socialized medicine is?

options.label: A
options.text: Integration of social medicine with health care

options.label: C
options.text: Free medical care at government expense, regulated by professional groups

questions.correct_answer: C. Free medical care at government expense, regulated by professional groups

questions.text: All of the following are common cause of post neonatal infant mortality in India, except?
All are true about Rashtriya Swasthya Bima Yojana, except?
Patient was given chloroquine and doxycycline for 7 days. Pt fever decline in 4 days but pt peripheral smear showed gametocytes of Plasmodium falciparum. This is which type of drug resistance?
Which of the below statement is not true about cohort study ?

options.label: A
options.text: Indicated when there is good evidence of association between exposure and disease

options.label: B
options.text: Done when incidence of disease is very low among exposed

options.label: D
options.text: Done when ample funds are available

questions.correct_answer: B. Done when incidence of disease is very low among exposed

questions.text: Among the following which is the non-essential micronutrient?
The eye condition for which the World Bank assistance was provided to the National Programme for Control of Blindness (1994-2001) is:
Which of the following Health organisation is not a part of Vision 2020 ?

options.label: D
options.text: International Agency for Prevention of Blindness

questions.text: Amniocentesis to detect chromosomal abnormalities
Identify the symbol given in Below image ?
The criteria to diagnose hypereosinophilic syndrome include all of the following EXCEPT:

options.label: A
options.text: Increased bone marrow eosinophils must be shown

options.label: B
options.text: Increased circulating eosinophils are not necessary

options.label: C
options.text: Exclusion of Primary myeloid leukemia is required

questions.correct_answer: B. Increased circulating eosinophils are not necessary

questions.text: A 20 year old man with a k/c/o sickle cell anemia presents to the ER with diffuse body pain, dyspnea, fever, and cough. He complained of having a bone pain crisis a day before which he tried to treat at home with oral hydration. On examination: raised blood pressure and heart rate, respiratory discomfort. SaO2: 83% —> increases to 91% on a non rebreather O2 face mask. CXR shows bilateral diffuse alveolar infiltrates. This is his third similar presentation in the past year. Which of the following statements are false regarding his condition?

options.label: A
options.text: Chronic therapy with oral hydroxyurea should be administered

options.label: C
options.text: The patient should receive daily sildenafil

questions.correct_answer: C. The patient should receive daily sildenafil

questions.text: In a 30 year old woman with idiopathic thrombocytopenic purpura (ITP), which of the following characteristics would be expected?
The resulting fractions of a blood test to reveal a hematocrit value are which of the following?

options.label: C
options.text: Plasma, buffy coat, and packed erythrocytes

options.label: D
options.text: Fibrinogen, platelets, buffy coat, and erythrocytes

questions.correct_answer: C. Plasma, buffy coat, and packed erythrocytes

questions.text: An 18 month old flexes her great toe towards the top of her foot and the other toes fan out. This happens after the sole of her foot has been firmly stroked by the doctor. A year later, this response wasn't seen. This change in response is because of which of the following events, postnatally?

options.label: A
options.text: Myelination of the corticospinal tract by oligodendrocytes

options.label: C
options.text: Myelination of the lumbar spinal nerves by Schwann cells

options.label: D
options.text: Apoptosis of exuberant neurons in the cortex by microglia

questions.correct_answer: A. Myelination of the corticospinal tract by oligodendrocytes

questions.text: A 62 year old man presents to the ER with sudden trouble speaking. On physical examination, he speaks slowly and deliberately, but he possesses good comprehension of what is being said. He appears to have weakness of the right lower side of his face and right arm. On further investigation, it is noted that these are signs of a brain infarct. What is the most likely cause of this event?

A Lewy body disease, Shy-Drager syndrome, is a disease characterized by orthostatic hypotension, impotence, abnormal sweating, hypersalivation, and pupil abnormalities. What is the major component of Lewy bodies, of the following options?

Workup of a 58 year old patient, who presents with fever and loss of weight, finds a lesion of the lower spinal cord lesion that destroys both the bone and the cartilage. This abnormality is caused by which of the following?
In a 32 year old runner, there is a presentation of pain in the plantar portion of her foot between the third and fourth metatarsal bones. Which is the most likely cause of this foot pain?

A 52 year old woman presents with headaches and progressively reducing vision over the past few months. Her relatives state that she does not see them when they aren’t directly in front of her and has been bumping into things recently. Physical examination: is unremarkable, other than the visual field defect shown below. A tumor in which of the following anatomical areas would result in these symptoms?

A 22 year old woman presents with increased abdominal girth of 3 months in duration. Physical examination shows ascites. On pelvic examination: 7.2cm right ovarian mass,which is removed at surgery. The histologic appearance of this neoplasm most closely resembles which of the following malignant neoplasms seen in men?

A 5 month old male infant is brought to the ER for evaluation of altered behavior and cyanosis. On examination, he has flaccid muscle tone and is taking shallow respirations. No preceding fever, cough, coryza, rash, or new medications; uncomplicated pre- and antenatal course. His diet: soft and pureed foods including yogurt, pureed vegetables, and bananas with added honey. No scheduled vaccinations within the past month. Deep tendon reflexes: absent. Most likely cause of his presentation is?

A woman dies of a chronic neurodegenerative disease. Spongiform encephalopathy with brain amyloidosis is seen on autopsy. This patient’s amyloidosis likely belongs to which of the following categorizations?

A 2-year-old boy is treated for recurrent fractures of his long bones. Physical examination reveals blue sclerae, loose joints, abnormal teeth, and poor hearing. Molecular diagnostic stud- ies will most likely demonstrate a mutation in the gene encoding which of the following proteins?

A female 3 day old neonate is brought to the ER after her parents noticed behavioral changes and shallow breathing. History: normal vaginal delivery, uncomplicated full-term delivery, normal antenatal care for 48 hrs in the hospital, and a normal suck and cry. On examination: generalized hypertonia and rigidity, occasional spasms, a foul-smelling brown material around the umbilical stump. Regarding the causative etiologic agent responsible for this infant’s illness, which is true?

options.label: A
options.text: Toxin works by inhibiting inhibitory presynaptic neurons

options.label: B
options.text: Blood cultures will give gram-positive rods

options.label: C
options.text: Diagnosis: with laboratory confirmation of causative agent

options.label: D
options.text: Toxin active at peripheral neuromuscular junctions

questions.correct_answer: A. Toxin works by inhibiting inhibitory presynaptic neurons

questions.text: A cervical Pap smear is obtained from a 30 year old patient who complains of increased vaginal discharge for 3.5 months. Two superficial squamous cells with enlarged nuclei and perinuclear vacuoles are seen. What is the most appropriate diagnosis?

A 57 year old man complains of weakness and 6kg weight loss in the past month. An abdominal CT scan shows the possibility of metastatic cancer involving the liver and the retroperitoneum. On a CT-guided biopsy: there’s a poorly-differentiated neoplasm. Electron microscopy of the biopsy is given in the image below. Which of the following is the most likely primary site for this patient’s neoplasm?

A young woman with SLE, that is complicated by nephropathy, hemolytic anemia, and pleuritis, recently discovered that she is pregnant. She is concerned about the effect her autoimmune disease may have on her infant. Most common cardiac complication in children born to mothers with SLE is?

A young boy dies after a severe episode of status asthmaticus. Histopathologic examination of the lung at autopsy is shown in the image. Which of the following describes the pathologic features shown in this specimen?

options.label: A
options.text: Smooth muscle hyperplasia and basement membrane thickening

options.label: C
options.text: Interstitial fibrosis of the lung parenchyma

options.label: D
options.text: Intra-alveolar hemorrhage and exudates containing neutrophils

questions.correct_answer: A. Smooth muscle hyperplasia and basement membrane thickening

questions.text: Abnormalities of CF, in a newborn diagnosed with cystic fibrosis, include which of the following?

options.label: B
options.text: Increased chloride secretion into the airways

options.label: C
options.text: Decreased water reabsorption from the airway lumen

questions.correct_answer: A. Accumulation of mucus in airways

questions.text: A 52 year old man, with severe alcoholism, is admitted with acute pancreatitis. Symptoms: present for 3 days, patient still drank heavily, now has persistent vomiting. On examination: severe epigastric and right upper quadrant tenderness, decreased bowel sounds, faint blue discoloration present around the umbilicus. What is the possible significance of this?
questions.correct_answer: A. CT abdomen: severe necrotizing pancreatitis.

questions.text: The genotype is found to be 46,XX, after the physical examination of a newborn child whose genitalia appear to be female, but masculinized. Most likely cause of this condition?
Potential indications for liver transplantation, are all of the following, EXCEPT:

An 18 year old female, who is 6 weeks postpartum, presents to the ER with fever, rising jaundice, abdominal pain, nausea, vomiting. Examination: positive for jaundice, pain of right upper quadrant, clear chest. Normal CXR. Which of the following tests is the best approprach?

options.label: C
options.text: Ultrasound of the right upper quadrant

questions.correct_answer: C. Ultrasound of the right upper quadrant

questions.text: A patient with a history of colon cancer treated with resection and chemo, 2 years ago, is now admitted after her lab work showed BUN: 66 mg/dL, creatinine: 4.7 mg/dL. She has mild fatigue and admits to taking NSAIDS for Lower back pain. Other than stopping NSAID and avoiding nephrotoxins, which of the following should be the next step?

options.label: A
options.text: Contrast CT of abdomen and pelvis

questions.text: Surgical management of acute diverticulitis is indicated best in which of the following patients?

options.label: A
options.text: 46 year-old woman with RA, treated with infliximab+prednisone

options.label: B
options.text: 60 year-old woman with diverticulitis, in descending colon and distal stricture

options.label: D
options.text: None of the above patients require surgical management.

questions.correct_answer: B. 60 year-old woman with diverticulitis, in descending colon and distal stricture

questions.text: A previously healthy 6 year old child suddenly complains of a headache and falls. In the ER: lethargic, left central facial weakness and left hemiparesis with conjugate ocular deviation to right. Most likely diagnosis?
Which one of the following statements about anorectal abscess is accurate?

options.label: A
options.text: Anorectal abscess: more common in diabetic patients.

options.label: B
options.text: Anorectal abscess: more common in women

questions.correct_answer: A. Anorectal abscess: more common in diabetic patients.

questions.text: An 80 year-old woman has become increasingly socially withdrawn and is brought to the OPD. The patient lives alone and is reluctant to visit or be visited by her children and family. There is also a foul odor in her apartment and on herself. Her only complaints are hemorrhoids. She has signs of depression on mental status examination. Most appropriate intervention at this time?
questions.correct_answer: C. Physical examination: genitourinary + rectal examination

questions.text: An infant is brought to a Pediatric OPD because her wet diapers turn black when they are exposed to air. Physical examination: normal. Urine: positive for reducing substance and on testing with ferric chloride. A deficiency of which of the following would result in this disorder?
A middle aged woman presents to the ER with complaints of the worst headache of her life. Most appropriate initial test for diagnosis?
A 59 year old man with facial and ocular weakness has been diagnosed with myasthenia gravis. All of the following tests are required before starting therapy EXCEPT:

A 75 year old man presents to the ER with left-sided arm weakness, rapidly improving over 4 hours. He has a past history of: hypertension, dyslipidemia, and coronary artery disease with a double coronary angioplasty. He is on: aspirin: 80 mg daily, metoprolol: 100 mg bid, benazepril: 20 mg daily, rosuvastatin: 10 mg daily, and clopidogrel:75 mg daily. On evaluation: 75% occlusion of the right internal carotid artery. What information is required by the patient to make a decision on whether he should undergo a carotid endarterectomy?

options.label: C
options.text: Risk of stroke in next 90 days

options.label: D
options.text: Risk of stroke in next year

questions.text: A 45 year-old man is examined in the ER for chest pain that developed after swallowing a piece of meat. He complains of intermittent episodes of meat getting stuck in his lower chest in the past 3 years and denies food regurgitation or heartburn. He is also able to swallow liquids without difficulty. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Potential causes of appendix obstruction and appendicitis include all of the following, EXCEPT:

A 42 year old man presented in August with abdominal pain for two days, diffuse myalgias, and severe headache. He said that he spent a day 2 weeks ago planting a garden and a week ago he ate raw oysters. On examination: blanchable macules on wrists and ankles. A provisional diagnosis is made, and his disease has a mortality rate of 40% if not treated. What is the responsible pathogen?
Infectious organism most likely to cause relative bradycardia during a febrile event is which one of the following?
Chronic dialysis: associated with increased risk of healthcare-associated pneumonia, is caused by which one of the following?
Which of the following patients should not be treated for C difficile infection?

options.label: A
options.text: 50 year old patient with diarrhea for 2 weeks, pseudomembranes found on colonoscopy

options.label: B
options.text: 62 year old woman with fever, leukocytosis, adynamic ileus, and a positive stool PCR for C difficile

options.label: C
options.text: 69 year old woman on antibiotic course, admitted to ICU for pain abdomen

options.label: D
options.text: 77 year old woman on amoxicillin for upper respiratory tract infection yesterday, now has two loose bowel movements/ day/ 3 days; afebrile, WBC: 8700

questions.correct_answer: D. 77 year old woman on amoxicillin for upper respiratory tract infection yesterday, now has two loose bowel movements/ day/ 3 days; afebrile, WBC: 8700

questions.text: Diagnostic features characterizing bacterial vaginosis is which one of the following?

options.label: A
options.text: Vaginal fluid pH <4.5, clue cells, profuse mixed microbiota on microscopic exam

options.label: B
options.text: Vaginal fluid pH >4.5, clue cells, profuse mixed microbiota on microscopic exam

options.label: C
options.text: Vaginal fluid pH ≥5.0, motile trichomonads on microscopic exam, and fishy odor

options.label: D
options.text: Vaginal fluid pH <4.5, lactobacilli on microscopic exam, and scant clear secretions

questions.correct_answer: B. Vaginal fluid pH >4.5, clue cells, profuse mixed microbiota on microscopic exam

questions.text: The following are all predisposing conditions that raise the risk of acute bacterial meningitis, caused by S pneumoniae EXCEPT:
On leaving the room of which one of the following patients would the use of an alcohol-based hand rub be inadequate?

options.label: A
options.text: 76 year old senior citizen with C. difficile infection and antibiotic use

options.label: B
options.text: 21 year old renal transplant recipient with varicella pneumonia

options.label: C
options.text: 44 year old man with MRSA furunculitis

options.label: D
options.text: 37 year old woman with advanced HIV and cavitary pulmonary TB

questions.correct_answer: A. 76 year old senior citizen with C. difficile infection and antibiotic use

questions.text: In the first 2 weeks after solid organ transplantation, the most common family of infection is?

A 42 year old woman, with AML, undergoes allogeneic stem cell transplantation. She is admitted to the hospital, two weeks later, with temperature: 102.1°F, pulse: 118 bpm, BP: 110/88 mmHg, SpO2: 88% on room air. Leukogram shows neutropenia. CXR: pulmonary infiltrates, CT scan: diffuse nodules with halo sign. The most likely to be diagnostic of her disease is?
Which of the followin regarding the bacterium, S aureus, is true?

options.label: A
options.text: anterior nares,oropharynx: most common sites of colonization

options.label: B
options.text: S aureus is always a pathogen, never a commensal

questions.correct_answer: A. anterior nares,oropharynx: most common sites of colonization

questions.text: A 21 year old woman with no past medical history, presents with 12 hours of dyspnea after a long car ride. She takes only an oral contraceptive. Physical examination: afebrile, RR: 22 breaths/min, BP: 120/80 mmHg, HR: 110 bpm, SpO2: 92% on room air. Normal CBC and CXR. What is the indicated management strategy?

options.label: A
options.text: Check D-dimer —> normal —> discharge with nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory therapy

options.label: B
options.text: Check D-dimer —> normal —> lower extremity ultrasound

options.label: C
options.text: Check D-dimer —> abnormal —> treat for DVT/ PE

options.label: D
options.text: Get contrast multislice CT of chest

questions.correct_answer: D. Get contrast multislice CT of chest
questions.explanation:
Clinical Variable DVT Score
Active cancer 1
Paralysis, paresis, or recent cast 1
Bedridden for >3 days; major surgery <12 weeks 1
Tenderness along distribution of deep veins 1
Entire leg swelling 1
Unilateral calf swelling>3 cm 1
Pitting edema 1
Collateral superficial nonvaricose veins 1
Alternative diagnosis at least as likely as DVT -2
High clinical likelihood of PE is point
Clinical Variable PE Score
Signs and Symptoms of DVT 3.0
Alternative diagnosis less likely than PE 3.0
Heart rate >100/min 1.5
Immobilization >3 days; surgery within 4 weeks 1.5
Prior PE or DVT 1.5
Hemoptysis 1.0
Cancer 1.0

questions.text: A 54 year-old man is examined for sudden-onset cough, dyspnea and yellow sputum production. He has a history of systemic hypertension and is on amlodipine. CXR: right upper lobe alveolar infiltrate; BUN: 54 mg/dL, creatinine: 2.9 mg/dL, calcium: 12.2 mg/dL, albumin of 3.2 g/dL. Sputum culture: Streptococcus pneumoniae. Which of the following tests will confirm the diagnosis of an underlying condition which predisposes him to pneumococcal pneumonia?
Which of the following results is the most powerful predictor of survival in patients with multiple myeloma?

An 18 year old reports 1 week of pain and has developed more severe pain on the right side of her lower abdomen over one day, and fever; pain in right upper abdomen worsened by deep breathing. She is sexually active with multiple partners. Examination: fever, normal breath sounds, mild tachycardia, and a tender right upper quadrant without rebound. Pelvic exam: normal cervical appearance, cervical motion tenderness, adnexal tenderness. A urine pregnancy test: negative; leukocytosis on CBC. Which of the following is true about her right upper quadrant tenderness, specifically?

options.label: B
options.text: CT chest to confirm septic pulmonary emboli

options.label: C
options.text: Laparoscopic examination to show inflammation of liver capsule.

options.label: D
options.text: Plasma PCR: for acute hepatitis C virus

questions.correct_answer: C. Laparoscopic examination to show inflammation of liver capsule.

questions.text: A 67 year old man, with a history of alcohol abuse, presents with several weeks of fever, night sweats, and production of sputum. Examination: low-grade temperature, weight loss: 7.5kg, foul breath. Blood work is unremarkable. Interferon-γ release assay is negative. CXR shown below. Which of the following is an appropriate initial therapy?

options.label: A
options.text: Bronchoscopy with biopsy of cavity to diagnose lung cancer

questions.correct_answer: C. IV penicillin for lung abscess

questions.text: An initial primary survey of the chest is done to quickly and accurately identify all of the following causes of cardiorespiratory compromise, except
Which one of the following is NOT a recognized complication of severe burn injury?

A 30 year-old man gets evaluated for coronary risk factors. He is healthy and has a history of no tobacco use, normal blood pressure, and no diabetes. However, he has a family history of high cholesterol on his maternal side. Tendon xanthomas are seen on physical examination. LDL: 388 mg/dL on fasting cholesterol. Most likely genetic disorder affecting this individual is?

A man, who is unresponsive after being found on a winter night on a park bench, is brought to the ER. No external signs of injury. Esophageal temperature probe: core body temperature is 34 °C. Management option not routinely indicated in this case?
Not an independent indication for laparotomy following trauma is which one of the following?
questions.correct_answer: A. Stab wound to anterior abdomen

questions.text: Complication of lymphoedema of the arm more likely to occur post resection of a breast tumour and axillary clearance in which of the following scenarios?

options.label: B
options.text: Mastectomy + axillary clearance + postoperative radiotherapy to the chest wall

options.label: C
options.text: Mastectomy + axillary clearance + postoperative radiotherapy to the axilla

questions.correct_answer: C. Mastectomy + axillary clearance + postoperative radiotherapy to the axilla

questions.text: In patients with noted intravascular hemolysis, which one of the following statements about hyperbilirubinemia is true?

options.label: A
options.text: Bilirubin: <4 mg/dL —> concomitant gallbladder/ biliary dysfunction

questions.correct_answer: B. Bilirubin: >4 mg/dL —> concomitant liver dysfunction

questions.text: Identify the program symbol shown in below image ?
Which of the following proteolytic enzymes is activated by acid hydrolysis of the proenzyme form?
Identify the organization showen in below image ?

A 5 year old girl has a speech delay and is also found to have a large peak in blood amino acid measurement. The amino acid that is causing this large peak migrates towards the anode —> which shows a positively charged side group along with carbonyl and amino groups. Which combination of amino acid to medical procedure is the most important in this case?
Identify the person given in below image ?
Which one of the following would result in an increased affinity of hemoglobin for O2?

options.label: D
options.text: Initial O2 binding to any of the four sites on deoxyhemoglobin molecule

questions.correct_answer: D. Initial O2 binding to any of the four sites on deoxyhemoglobin molecule

questions.text: Which one of the following is done by a noncompetitive inhibitor of an enzyme?
Fructose was previously recommended for patients with diabetes mellitus. Which of the following would be an appropriate explanation for this?

options.label: C
options.text: Fructose: has specific kinase in liver that allows bypass of phosphofructokinase (PFK)

options.label: D
options.text: Fructose: phosphorylated and cleaved to triose phosphates, these can’t be used for gluconeogenesis

questions.correct_answer: C. Fructose: has specific kinase in liver that allows bypass of phosphofructokinase (PFK)

questions.text: The following drugs all interfere with testicular function EXCEPT:

A 74 year woman is hospitalized for a right hip fracture. She is transferred to rehabilitation after initial surgical treatment. Her 25-hydroxyvitamin D levels are at 18.4 ng/L. What is the recommended treatment in this patient?

options.label: B
options.text: Vitamin D3 - 800 U daily with calcium carbonate - 1500 mg daily

options.label: D
options.text: Vitamin D3 - 2000 U daily with calcium carbonate - 1500 mg daily

questions.correct_answer: D. Vitamin D3 - 2000 U daily with calcium carbonate - 1500 mg daily

questions.text: Regulation of lipogenesis takes place due to which one of the following enzymes most importantly?
Which of the following medications would you prescribe to reduce attacks and prevent the development of systemic amyloidosis in a 17 year old who is diagnosed with familial Mediterranean fever?
All of the following agents to have disease-modifying antirheumatic drug efficacy in patients with rheumatoid arthritis EXCEPT:
The correct sequence in gene repair mechanisms in non-mutated repair processes is which one of the following?

options.label: A
options.text: Recognition, nicking, excision, replacement, and sealing

options.label: B
options.text: Nicking, recognition, excision, sealing, and replacement

options.label: C
options.text: Nicking, sealing, recognition, excision, and replacement

options.label: D
options.text: Nicking, excision, replacement, sealing, and recognition

questions.correct_answer: A. Recognition, nicking, excision, replacement, and sealing

questions.text: A man, who has recently been diagnosed with systemic hypertension, is prescribed lisinopril as an initial monotherapy. His right hand is swollen, mildly itching, and tingling with eventual lip swelling and difficulty in breathing after only three days of taking Lisinopril. Accurate description of this condition is?

options.label: A
options.text: Symptoms are due to direct activation of mast cells by lisinopril

options.label: B
options.text: Symptoms due to impaired bradykinin degradation by lisinopril

options.label: D
options.text: Peripheral blood analysis: deficiency of C1 inhibitor

questions.correct_answer: B. Symptoms due to impaired bradykinin degradation by lisinopril

questions.text: In a 56 year old man with hemochromatosis resulting in cirrhosis and portal hypertension, there is presentation with altered mental status, chronic ascites, one previous esophageal bleed. He is on propranolol. Afebrile, normal vital signs. Lab examination: Hb 10.1, creatinine 1.4, BUN 45. Paracentesis reveals clear fluid with 900 WBC. What is the most appropriate treatment?
One of the following drugs has a direct toxic effect on hepatocytes, choose the right option?

A 39 year old woman with AIDS, has a CD4 count of 35/ μL and presents with odynophagia and progressive dysphagia, daily fevers and 10kg weight loss. BMI - 16, weight - 42kg, temperature - 100.9°F. On esophagogastroduodenoscopy, non- vesicular serpiginous ulcers are seen in the distal esophagus. What is the treatment for this patient’s esophagitis?

In a 32 year-old man with end-stage cystic fibrosis, who undergoes lung transplantation, there is progressive decline in his kidney function. Which one of the following medications is the most likely cause?
Quick activation or deactivation by phosphorylation of specific amino acid residues is catalyzed by which one of the following enzymes?
One of the following medications has been shown to reduce mortality in patients of heart failure with decreased ejection fraction?
Which one of the following, about nesiritide, is accurate in patients with acute decompensated heart failure, who require invasive hemodynamic monitoring?

options.label: A
options.text: No significant effect on blood pressure.

options.label: B
options.text: Improvement in renal perfusion in acute decompensated heart failure.

options.label: D
options.text: Reduces pulmonary capillary wedge more quickly than IV nitrates

questions.correct_answer: D. Reduces pulmonary capillary wedge more quickly than IV nitrates

questions.text: All of the following medications, that are used in primary management of STEMI, are accurately matched to their respective mechanism of effect EXCEPT

options.label: C
options.text: β-Adrenergic antagonists – myocardial oxygen consumption reduction

questions.text: Which of the following structures would accomplish detection of angular acceleration?

options.label: B
options.text: Hair cells of organ of Corti

questions.text: Which one of the following is directly involved in sound transduction?

options.label: A
options.text: Neurotransmitter release onto afferent endings of CN VIII

options.label: B
options.text: Shearing motion of tympanic membrane against stereocilia

options.label: C
options.text: Tectorial membrane movement causing in hair cell depolarization

options.label: D
options.text: Vibration at round window via stapes

questions.correct_answer: C. Tectorial membrane movement causing in hair cell depolarization

questions.text: A man presents with severe abdominal distention and pain. He has a palpable bladder. After catheterization, 1.7 L of urine passes. He hasn’t passed urine for 2 days. BUN: 89 mg/dL, creatinine: 6.5 mg/dL. He eventually passes 6.2 L of urine on the third and fourth days of hospital admission. What is the most likely explanation for his increased urine output?

A 13 year old boy is brought to the ER due to nasal fullness and bleeding. On inspection: enlarged cervical lymph nodes. Biopsy of node: nasopharyngeal carcinoma. Best management strategy for this patient?

A 67 year old man complains of lightning-like pains to his thighs for the past few minutes. There is impaired proprioception and vibratory sense in his feet. Patient with wide-based, ataxic gait, positive Romberg sign. His wife was treated for syphilis 32 years ago, but he was never tested or treated for syphilis. Ocular finding most consistent with neurosyphilis is?

options.label: A
options.text: Pupils reactive to accommodation but not light

options.label: B
options.text: Pupils reactive to light but not accommodation

options.label: C
options.text: Pupils reactive to both light and accommodation

options.label: D
options.text: Pupils nonreactive to both light or accommodation

questions.correct_answer: A. Pupils reactive to accommodation but not light

questions.text: The outward recoil of the chest wall equals to the inward elastic recoil of the lung at which of the following capacities?
Which one of the following will result in a faster rate of absorption of alcohol from gut into blood?

options.label: A
options.text: Concurrent intake of a high-protein meal

options.label: B
options.text: Concentration of alcohol of more than 20% by volume

options.label: D
options.text: Concurrent intake of a high-fat meal

questions.correct_answer: C. Coadministration with a carbonated beverage

questions.text: An old man, who is a smoker, presents with a 4 month history of enlarged lymph node in his left neck. He denies fevers, night sweats, fatigue, or cough. On physical examination: 1.5-cm hard, fixed mass below angle of mandible in left neck. Most likely cause of an enlarged lymph node in the neck, is?
The following are all true regarding Iridoschisis, except:

options.label: B
options.text: Due to a split between iris stroma and pigment epithelium

options.label: D
options.text: associated with glaucoma in 50% of cases

questions.correct_answer: B. Due to a split between iris stroma and pigment epithelium

questions.text: A woman, who underwent total thyroidectomy for multinodular goiter 7 months ago, presents with persistent hoarseness. Nerve most likely injured during her operation is which one of the following?
When the plasma glucose falls below 80–85 mg/dL, which one of the following physiologic changes is the first to occur?
An HIV-positive patient presents to the ER with deep boring ear pain, red inflamed ear canal and pinna. All of the following statements are true, except:

options.label: C
options.text: Treated conservatively with rest and topical hygiene

questions.correct_answer: C. Treated conservatively with rest and topical hygiene

questions.text: A 20 year old man, with a 1-day history of discomfort and a ‘leaky’ left eye, presents to the OPD. His brother also had similar symptoms. His vision is entirely unchanged and there is no history of previous trauma. Physical examination: a red eye with uniform engorgement of all conjunctival blood vessels. What is the likely diagnosis in this case?
Which one of the following options is true as a differential diagnosis for a patient presenting with rhinitis?
Normal glucose tolerance is?

options.label: B
options.text: Fasting plasma glucose <126 mg/dL following an oral glucose challenge

options.label: C
options.text: Fasting plasma glucose <100 mg/dL, hemoglobin A1C <5.6%

questions.correct_answer: C. Fasting plasma glucose <100 mg/dL, hemoglobin A1C <5.6%

questions.text: In a patient who requires complete resection of the pituitary gland after the diagnosis of a pituitary tumor, which of the following listed functions of adrenal gland will be preserved immediately postoperatively?

options.label: A
options.text: Morning peak of plasma cortisol level

options.label: B
options.text: Sodium retention in response to hypovolemia

questions.correct_answer: B. Sodium retention in response to hypovolemia

questions.text: All of the following are true about the management of chronic/primary open angle glaucoma, except:
Voice abusers are at risk of developing all of the following conditions, except:
Which one of the mechanisms enlisted below of autoimmunity is mainly responsible for the development of rheumatic fever?
Which one of the following is a major source of heat loss in normal human adults?
Which property of SA nodal cells allows it to act as the primary pacemaker of the heart?

options.label: A
options.text: It’s location near superior lateral area of right atrium

options.label: D
options.text: The isolated cells with ability to depolarize spontaneously

questions.text: An 83 year old man presents to the ER with a sudden loss of central aspects of his visual fields. On examination: bilateral visual acuity is mildly reduced. Central lines on an Amsler chart: distorted. Peripheral fields: normal. Fundoscopy: multiple retinal infiltrates, the macula is normal in size and shape. Most likely diagnosis?
Mean QRS vectors in the frontal electrocardiographic plane are matched appropriately to their designation in which one of the following?
Which of the following is the most appropriate statement about chemical ocular injury?

options.label: B
options.text: The severity of injury is unrelated to the substance

questions.text: A patient with a history of ischaemic heart disease and A-Fib presents to the ER with abdominal pain. CT shows features of ischemic bowel. The patient's blood gases are as follows: pH = 7.27 paO2 = 11 paCO2 = 2.9 HCO3 = 17 Base excess = –9 Which of the following describes the patient's acid–base status accurately?

options.label: B
options.text: Metabolic acidosis with adequate respiratory compensation

options.label: D
options.text: Metabolic acidosis with inadequate respiratory compensation

questions.correct_answer: D. Metabolic acidosis with inadequate respiratory compensation

questions.text: A 44 year old man presents with pain in his left eye. He was recently doing some repair work in the house and felt ‘some material entering his eye’. He does not wear contact lenses and his eye has been extremely watery. He is unable to open it properly. The following statements regarding assessment are accurate, except

options.label: D
options.text: Eyelid laceration is sutured in the ER

questions.correct_answer: D. Eyelid laceration is sutured in the ER

questions.text: The renal ability to excrete concentrated urine will rise if:

options.label: A
options.text: Permeability of the collecting duct to H2O increases

options.label: B
options.text: Rate of flow of filtrate through the loop of Henle rises

options.label: D
options.text: Na-K pump activity in loop of Henle decreases

questions.correct_answer: B. Rate of flow of filtrate through the loop of Henle rises

questions.text: A type of injury, that is usually made with a blunt object, that can be seen on physical examination and is dated by the color change over time is most likely to be described by which one of the following terms?
In young children, what is the common presentation of retinoblastoma, a malignant tumour of the retina?
In a lady who was shot by a revolver at a distance of 2m, the inlet would be?
All of the following are features of barbiturate poisoning except:
The care to provide painless shortening of life in a terminal illness is termed as:

A young woman presents to the OPD with progressively worsening right thumb and wrist pain. There is pain on pinching her thumb against her other fingers. Physical examination: mild swelling and tenderness over radial styloid process. Phalen maneuver is negative. Which diagnosis is most likely?
About the anatomy of the pituitary gland, which of the following is true?

options.label: A
options.text: Growth hormone is derived from proopiomelanocortin

options.label: B
options.text: Prolactin-secreting cells are majority of cells in anterior pituitary.

options.label: D
options.text: Posterior pituitary has dual arterial supply.

questions.correct_answer: C. Formed from Rathke pouch embryonically.

questions.text: Warrant cases are punishable with imprisonment
Tissue biopsy for histopathological examination should be sent in:
A 31 year old female patient presents with a right parotid region swelling. Which one of the following structures does NOT lie within the parotid gland?
Which of the following structures is not encountered or traversed during the insertion of a tracheostomy?

A 40 year old mother of two wants to prevent relapse as she is recovering from alcohol dependence. On investigation, she is found to have a medical history of a hypertensive crisis resulting in a stroke. Which of the following medications would be appropriate in this case?

Fetal blood from placenta is almost 80% oxygenated. But, mixture with unoxygenated blood at various points reduces this oxygen content. Which one of the following fetal vessels contains blood with the highest O2 content?
Which one of the following would be interfered with on Inhibition of actin assembly by cytochalasins?
Gene rearrangement of cytotoxic T cells occurs primarily in?
Merkel cells, modified epidermal cells, function primarily in which one of the following?

options.label: C
options.text: Detection of texture and shape during active touch

questions.correct_answer: D. Detection of transient vibratory stimuli

questions.text: An alcoholic man presents with severe epigastric pain, which radiates to his back. Amylase and lipase levels: elevated, diagnosis: acute pancreatitis. He has 6 Ranson’s criteria, including a PaO2 < 60 mm Hg, over 48 hours. CXR: bilateral pulmonary infiltrates, wedge pressure: low. What is required to make a diagnosis of ARDS?

options.label: C
options.text: Pulmonary capillary wedge pressure > 18 mm Hg

questions.text: A 30 year old insomniac reports difficulty both falling and staying asleep as she cannot calm her mind and states that she has always been a ‘worrier’. A diagnosis of generalized anxiety disorder is made. All of the following characteristics are common to this disorder EXCEPT:

options.label: A
options.text: Episodic palpitations, shortness of breath lasting 30 minutes

options.label: C
options.text: Concomitant feelings of hopelessness and sadness

questions.correct_answer: A. Episodic palpitations, shortness of breath lasting 30 minutes

questions.text: What is the best course of action for a 55 year old patient with glioblastoma multiforme in the right parietal lobe, who has experienced his first generalized tonic-clonic seizure?

options.label: D
options.text: Initiate therapy only if additional seizures occur

questions.text: The primary regulator of salivary secretion is?

A 40-year-old man is evaluated as part of an executive physical examination. He has read about different screening procedures on the Internet and is interested in being screened for hemochromatosis. A 43 year old man wants to be screened for hemochromatosis after reading about it on the internet. He is healthy and takes a daily multivitamin. His father drank alcohol heavily and died of cirrhosis at 56 years of age. There is no other liver disease in his family. What is the most appropriate first step to screen this disorder?
questions.correct_answer: D. Transferrin saturation and serum ferritin

questions.text: A 70 year old man with a history of diabetes, renal insufficiency, and CAD, presents to the ER in septic shock from emphysematous cholecystitis. Sp02: 100% on 6-L nasal cannula oxygen delivery, Hb: 7.2 mg/dL. Venous SpO2: 58%. Which of the following will best improve his oxygen delivery?

options.label: B
options.text: Transfer him to a hyperbaric chamber

questions.correct_answer: A. Transfuse two units of PRBCs

questions.text: In which of the following patients must sedatives, as premedication, be avoided?
Which of the following maintain the low pH in the vagina?

options.label: A
options.text: Proton pump similar to parietal cells

options.label: B
options.text: Acid secretion from intracellular carbonic acid

options.label: C
options.text: Secretion of lactic acid by stratified squamous epithelium

options.label: D
options.text: Bacterial metabolism: glycogen to lactic acid

questions.correct_answer: D. Bacterial metabolism: glycogen to lactic acid

questions.text: Potential causes of elevated LDL include all of the following, EXCEPT:
Which one of the following is a primary risk factor for difficult mask ventilation?

options.label: D
options.text: Inability to bring mandibular incisors anterior to the maxillary incisors

questions.correct_answer: D. Inability to bring mandibular incisors anterior to the maxillary incisors

questions.text: In jaw dislocation, articular disk displacement after the articular tubercle of the temporomandibular joint results from excessive contraction and spasm of which of the following muscles?
Failure of sixth aortic arch arteries to form would lead to loss of blood supply to which one of the following essential organs?

A 29 year old new mother presents to the psychiatrist stating she is depressed, and appears to have postpartum blues, because she gave her child growth retardation, a short philtrum, thin upper lip, microcephaly, microphthalmia, short palpebral fissures, midface hypoplasia. Which is the most appropriate diagnosis of the mother, apart from postpartum blues?

A 32 year old man goes to the OPD with complaints of impaired ejaculation. He is on: perphenazine, digoxin, propranolol, methadone and periodic cannabis usage. What is the most likely cause of this patient’s problems with ejaculation?
A man’s HIV test is positive, but he has no signs or symptoms of AIDS. In 25% of patients with a positive HIV test, which one of the following psychiatric diagnoses may develop?
All of the following laboratory tests are consistent with a diagnosis of DKA, EXCEPT:
questions.explanation:
DKA HHS
Glucose, mg/dl 250-600 600-1200
Sodium meg/L 125-135 135-145
Potassium Normal to ↑ Normal
Osmolality mosms/ml 300-320 330-380(>350)
Plasma ketones ++++ +/-
Serum bicarbonate <15meg/L Normal to slightly ↓
Arterial pH 6.8-7.3 >7-3
Arterial pCO2 20:30 Normal
Anion gap ↑ Normal to slightly ↑

questions.text: In families of patients with schizophrenia, who are overtly hostile and overly controlling, the schizophrenic patient would be affected which of the following ways?

options.label: C
options.text: Familial behaviors will lead to patient’s first break of disease

questions.text: A man presents to the ER with numbness and weakness in his legs and feet. On exam: he is numb to the knees, with marked weakness in ankle dorsiflexion and plantar flexion; hepatosplenomegaly and a dark tan with no history of sun exposure. He has a history of diabetes and hypothyroidism. Which of the following tests are required to make his diagnosis?

A 57 year old woman complains of progressive stiffening and right shoulder pain. Medical history: several episodes of bursitis of right shoulder, treated with NSAIDs and steroid injections; and diabetes mellitus. Physical examination: right shoulder is tender to touch, limited flexion, extension, and abduction of passive and active range of motion. RHint shoulder X-ray: osteopenia with no evidence of joint erosion or osteophytes. Most likely diagnosis?
Peak cortisol levels are seen at which of the following times of day?

A 30 year old runner presents with complaints of aching pain on lateral aspect of left knee, with a burning sensation reaching lateral aspect of left thigh. . She is training for a marathon and runs 80-100 kms/ week. Knee is not hot or swollen. Physical examination: point tenderness over lateral femoral condyle, that worsens on flexing knee. Which one of the following treatments would not be recommended for this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: Assessment of the patient’s running shoes

options.label: C
options.text: Ibuprofen 600–800 mg, every 6 hours as required

questions.text: In a 32 year old man, with progressive breast enlargement during the past 6 months, with no drug use, lab evaluation shows reduced LH and reduced testosterone. Further evaluation of this patient will include which of the following?
questions.correct_answer: B. Estradiol and hCG levels measurement

questions.text: Best definition of ‘enthesitis’?

options.label: A
options.text: Palpable vibratory/ crackling sensation with joint motion

options.label: B
options.text: Inflammation of saclike cavity near joint that reduces friction

options.label: C
options.text: Inflammation at site of tendinous or ligamentous insertion into bone

options.label: D
options.text: Inflammation of periarticular membrane lining joint capsule

questions.correct_answer: C. Inflammation at site of tendinous or ligamentous insertion into bone

questions.text: All of the following statements are incorrect about osteoarthritis, except?

options.label: A
options.text: MRI required to evaluate any other causes

options.label: B
options.text: There is direct stimulation of pain receptors in joint cartilage.

options.label: C
options.text: Osteoarthritis: is the 2nd MCC of arthritis

options.label: D
options.text: Synovial fluid WBC: <1000 cells/μL in osteoarthritis

questions.correct_answer: D. Synovial fluid WBC: <1000 cells/μL in osteoarthritis

questions.text: A 33 year old woman, with diagnosed cystic fibrosis and vitamin D deficiency with a T-score of –2.9 in the lumbar hip and spine, is started on initial treatment with alendronate: 70 mg/ week, cholecalciferol: 5000 U daily, and calcium carbonate: 1500 mg/day. When should the bone densitometry testing be repeated to assess therapy response in this patient?
Which one of the following statements about pulmonary sarcoidosis is true?

options.label: A
options.text: Cutaneous involvement is more common than lung involvement

options.label: C
options.text: Pulmonary hypertension doesn’t respond to therapy in sarcoidosis.

options.label: D
options.text: Pulmonary infiltrates in sarcoidosis: an upper lobe process.

questions.correct_answer: D. Pulmonary infiltrates in sarcoidosis: an upper lobe process.

questions.text: A woman presents to the ER with progressively severe abdominal pain, initially at umbilicus, now localized to her right lower quadrant. She reports vague loss of appetite for a day, with no bowel movements or vomiting. Temperature: 100.8°F and HR: 105 bpm. Abdomen: tender in right lower quadrant. Urine pregnancy test: negative. Imaging most likely to confirm her diagnosis is?
Which one of the following infectious clinical syndromes does NOT typically cause vesicular lesions?

A 32 year old woman presents with B/L lower extremity edema, polyuria, moderate left-sided flank pain from 2 weeks ago. Examination: normal vital signs, normal blood pressure. 2+ edema: bilateral lower extremities. 24-hour urine collection: 3.5 g of protein. Urinalysis: proteinuria. Serum creatinine: 0.7 mg/dL. Renal vein thrombosis is suspected. What test would be chosen for evaluation?

options.label: D
options.text: Ultrasound with Doppler for renal veins

questions.text: A 54 year old woman with chronic migraines and depression and chronic migraine presents with several months of dry mouth and dry eyes, photosensitivity and eye burning. On examination: dry, erythematous, sticky oral mucosa. All of the following tests would be positive in this patient EXCEPT:

A 43 year old HIV-positive man, who is not on antiretroviral therapy, has a recent CD4 cell count of 43/μL. He presents: several nontender red, ulcerated plaques, two weeks of fever and malaise. Pathologic examination: lobular proliferations of small blood vessels —> lined by enlarged endothelial cells —> interspersed with mixed infiltrates of neutrophils and lymphocytes. Blood cultures: positive for Bartonella henselae. This patient’s skin lesions is caused by?

A 72 year old woman, with a recent diagnosis of small-cell lung cancer, now complains of headaches, and confusion. Metastatic disease to the brain is suspected. MRI: mass lesion in right parietal lobe. Which MRI technique would most accurately identify the extent of the edema surrounding the lesion?

A 42 year old man is evaluated for a year of recurrent bilateral ear swelling and his right ear has become floppy. On examination, the left ear: beefy red color and the pinna: tender and swollen. Which of the following is the most appropriate diagnosis?

A 32 year old woman presents with a 5-day long widespread skin rash. She is also taking sulfa medication for recurrent cystitis. Skin biopsy: leukocytoclastic vasculitis of dermal venules. What is the probable diagnosis?

An HIV+ teenager, not on therapy, complains of 2 weeks of progressive malaise with low-grade fevers and is unable to get out of bed to go to college. He doesn’t have cough or sputum. CXR shown below. A provisional diagnosis of TB is made. Which of the following forms of tuberculosis is most likely?

A 24 year old woman reports that she develops symptoms annually during August to November. She complains of rhinitis with post nasal drip and cough, itchy and watery eyes. She take Loratadine 10 mg daily, which improves her symptoms. What is the most likely allergen in this case?

On physical examination of a 2-day-old neonate: multiple blisters on trunk and extremities. Skin biopsy: separation of basal layer of epidermis from basement membrane, no inflammatory cells. Immunofluorescence microscopy: No antibody deposits. Most likely diagnosis?
Presence of HepB e antigen signifies which of the following in a chronic hepatitis B virus infection?
All of the following statements about cardiac cirrhosis are false, except?

options.label: A
options.text: AST and ALT levels: may mimic acute viral hepatitis.

options.label: B
options.text: Budd-Chiari syndrome: same as cardiac cirrhosis, clinically

options.label: C
options.text: Echocardiography: gold standard for diagnosing constrictive pericarditis

options.label: D
options.text: Veno-occlusive disease: often confused with cardiac cirrhosis

questions.correct_answer: A. AST and ALT levels: may mimic acute viral hepatitis.

questions.text: A patient with Sjögren syndrome has the following lab findings: plasma sodium: 139 mEq/L chloride: 112 mEq/L bicarbonate: 15 mEq/L potassium: 3.0 mEq/L pH: 6.0 sodium: 15 mEq/L potassium: 10 mEq/L chloride: 12 mEq/L What is the most likely diagnosis?

A young man is treated with induction chemotherapy for acute lymphoblastic leukemia. His initial WBC count prior to treatment: 156,000/μL. All of the following are possible expected complications during his treatment EXCEPT:

A 49 year old man with a BMI of 28.8 kg/m2 is diagnosed with obstructive sleep apnea. He has an apnea-hypopnea index of 42/hr and a minimum O2 saturation of 78%. Most appropriate initial therapy for this patient is which of the following?

A woman presents to the ER with acute shortness of breath. Helical CT: no evidence of pulmonary embolus, dilatation of the ascending aorta to 4.3 cm. All the following are linked with this finding EXCEPT:
The largest delay between symptom onset and appropriate therapy for patients with ST-segment elevation MI usually occurs in what time interval?

options.label: A
options.text: Between pain onset and patient’s decision to ask for help

options.label: B
options.text: Between patient call and emergency team arrival

options.label: C
options.text: Between emergency team arrival and arrival at hospital

options.label: D
options.text: Between arrival at hospital and decision to start reperfusion therapy

questions.correct_answer: A. Between pain onset and patient’s decision to ask for help

questions.text: On routine antenatal bloods, a 32 year old woman is found to be Rhesus negative. What is correct about the management of her pregnancy?

options.label: B
options.text: Kleihauser test performed if vaginal bleeding later in pregnancy

options.label: C
options.text: only two doses of anti-D administered

options.label: D
options.text: if current pregnancy doesn’t have Rh negative implications, neither will the future pregnancies

questions.correct_answer: B. Kleihauser test performed if vaginal bleeding later in pregnancy

questions.text: The best contraceptive in a 45 year old woman with a BMI of 40, who is a smoker with multiple fibroids, in a stable relationship with a complete family, and who has a past history of peritonitis is which one of the following?
The recommended management of an 88 year old woman with IHD and a procidentia of uterus is:
The measurement of ovarian reserve is done best by which of the following hormones?
All of the following are clinical signs and findings of the presence of ovulation, except?

options.label: B
options.text: Increase in basal body temperature >0.5°F in second half of menstrual cycle

options.label: D
options.text: Estrogen peak during secretory phase of menstrual cycle

questions.correct_answer: D. Estrogen peak during secretory phase of menstrual cycle

questions.text: A 16 year old girl who is not sexually active presents with left iliac fossa pain. USG: 5 cm complex cyst on left ovary, MRI: fatty deposits, solid and calcified elements. The likely diagnosis is:
n increased risk in multiple pregnancy is not seen in which of the following?
In the developmental progression from childhood through puberty to menopause, all of the following statements regarding levels of FSH and LH are true except?

options.label: A
options.text: FSH is suppressed from birth to 20 months of age.

options.label: B
options.text: Increased LH during the neonatal year (birth to 20 months).

options.label: C
options.text: Decreased LH and FSH during childhood before puberty.

options.label: D
options.text: At the onset of puberty, GnRH drives pituitary FSH and LH levels.

questions.correct_answer: A. FSH is suppressed from birth to 20 months of age.

questions.text: Which of the following occurs first in majority of girls with normal pubertal development?
Which of the following women has the lowest risk of breast cancer?

options.label: A
options.text: A woman with menarche at 12 years, first child at 24 years, and menopause at 47 years

options.label: B
options.text: A woman with menarche at 14 years, first child at 17 years, and menopause at 52 years

options.label: C
options.text: A woman with menarche at 16 years, first child at 17 years, and menopause at 42 years

options.label: D
options.text: A woman with menarche at 16 years, first child at 32 years, and menopause at 52 years

questions.correct_answer: C. A woman with menarche at 16 years, first child at 17 years, and menopause at 42 years

questions.text: A couple married for 5 years have been attempting to conceive a child for the last 12 months. Despite regular intercourse, they have not achieved pregnancy. They are both 32 years of age and have no medical problems. Neither of the partner is taking medications. Which of the following is the most common cause of infertility?
A 36 year old woman attends for a routine dating scan. Which of the following pieces of information will not be possible to get from a dating scan?

A 33 years old woman with diabetes mellitus, renal insufficiency, and hypertension presented to the hospital with seizures during week 38 of her pregnancy. Her blood pressure is 165/95 mm Hg. She has 4+ proteinuria. Management should include all of the following except?

You are seeing a 36 year old woman in clinic as her family practitioner. In her history, she reports no illness and is taking no medications. She does mention that she and her husband have been trying to conceive a child for the past 7 months but have been unsuccessful. Which of the following would be an appropriate response?

options.label: A
options.text: “You have likely entered menopause and cannot have a child.”

options.label: B
options.text: “We do not recommend evaluation by a fertility specialist until you and her husband have tried for at least 12 months.”

options.label: C
options.text: “I will refer you to an expert in fertility issues.”

options.label: D
options.text: “Most causes of infertility are related to the male. I suggest you have him evaluated.”

questions.correct_answer: C. “I will refer you to an expert in fertility issues.”

questions.text: A 28 years old woman presented with longstanding type 1 diabetes on insulin. She tells you that she and her husband have decided to try to conceive. Which of the following is true regarding reproductive issues and diabetes?

options.label: A
options.text: Women with diabetes have a reduced reproductive capacity.

options.label: B
options.text: Insulin crosses the placenta and may affect the fetus adversely.

options.label: C
options.text: The patient should expect her insulin requirements to increase during pregnancy.

options.label: D
options.text: High maternal serum glucose increases the risk of fetal abnormalities.

questions.correct_answer: D. High maternal serum glucose increases the risk of fetal abnormalities.

questions.text: A 26 years old woman is in her last trimester of a normal pregnancy. Synthesis of milk by her mammary glands specifically requires which of the following?

A 32 years old G2P1 female presents to her obstetrician with abdominal discomfort, increased back pain, shortness of breath, and swelling in her feet and ankles. Ultrasound reveals an amniotic fluid index (AFI) of 27 cm. The condition is caused by which of the following?

options.label: C
options.text: Precocious development of the swallowing reflex in the fetus

questions.text: A woman is 24 weeks pregnant with her first child. She developed cellulitis in the right leg and requires antibiotic treatment. Which of the following antibiotics should not be used during the second and third trimesters of pregnancy?

A 16 week pregnant 24 year-old woman is seen for routine follow-up of an uncomplicated pregnancy. What is the recommended screening and treatment of asymptomatic bacteriuria in this particular patient?

options.label: A
options.text: Screen and treated in 3rd trimester only.

options.label: B
options.text: Screened with urine culture, not treated unless symptomatic.

options.label: C
options.text: Screened at 16wks and treated if culture is positive.

questions.correct_answer: C. Screened at 16wks and treated if culture is positive.

questions.text: The following are traditional contraindications for oral HRT in postmenopausal women EXCEPT:

options.label: D
options.text: CHD risk over future 10 years of 5%–10%

questions.correct_answer: D. CHD risk over future 10 years of 5%–10%

questions.text: A 10-year-old child presented to your clinic. On examination you are seeing the findings (as given in the image below). What is your diagnosis ?
Which of the following is true about Cephalhematoma?

options.label: A
options.text: Its size is maximum at birth

options.label: D
options.text: It is due to hemorrhage in the layers of scalp

questions.correct_answer: C. It is limited by periosteum
